text: Adam does almost everything at the house
walks the dog picks out the trash I'm
always like I'll clean up he's late now
I got that I'd only really did the
things he can't do change lightbulbs
mosquitoes get in there up on the wall
and he can't do that
changing the lightbulb is a simple task
and I just cannot do it it's one of the
things that even after 26 years in the
wheelchair I still get frustrated about
when I was 16 I was in a car accident
broke four vertebrae in my back and
became an incomplete paraplegic I've had
a lot of relationships a lot of
boyfriends
I was married twice had an early
marriage in my early 20s my relationship
history was relatively sparse the
longest relationship I had was a year I
had posted on a local kayaking board I
got a note from Adam we just started a
very casual conversation that way it
quickly ramped up to a much more than
casual conversation I think I asked him
why are you in a wheelchair and then
immediately I was like oh I'm so sorry
for being so rude and he was like no no
that's okay I started asking a million
questions about sacs pretty soon he was
completely alike
and not weird he just gave really
straightforward funny answers I can't
really give them to you without being
sort of dirty I was at my house I had
tweaked something in my back
got out the heating pad laid down on the
couch on the heating pad I had fallen
asleep woke up my back felt a lot better
we had to burn like two inches by four
inches on his back I was like I think we
need to go to the emergency room and he
was like I think we need to get some
neosporin and go to bed she was none too
pleased that I was so Cavalier I started
crying and crying and then they sort of
all came out the wheelchairs a little
more than I thought
going into all this I'd be devastated if
anything happened to you and I'm mad at
you for that madam was just like I know
but I'm not going anywhere I think Adams
better at relationships I'm okay you
know I think he's better and it's funny
because I think most people would say
that I'm nicer and I'm more outgoing but
Adam is really sort of at a core level I
think more patient even after 26 years
of being in the wheelchair there are
challenges many times every single day
the way I have adjusted to that is you
know what even if it's not working out
right now that's okay there's going to
be a way that we are going to make this
work
you
you
Oh
